intro: Gynopachis oblongata, commonly known as the broadleaf burrweed, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb with a sprawling growth habit, featuring hairy stems and alternate, ovate to lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal spikes, followed by distinctive burr-like fruits that aid in seed dispersal. Its adaptability to harsh environments makes it a common weed in disturbed soils. The species is characterized by its unique morphology and ecological resilience.
